name: JavaScript Proxy Autoconfig File
summary: A JVS file is a JavaScript-based configuration file used by web browsers to automatically determine whether to use a proxy server when connecting to specific websites. It contains a function called FindProxyForURL() , which evaluates the requested URL and decides whether the browser should route the request through a proxy server or connect directly. JVS files help organizations manage and control Internet access without requiring users to configure proxy settings manually.

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.
